intro: Galium ciliatum var. normale, commonly known as the silky bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate or ascending stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and have a ciliate margin, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
